message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SI

This paper presents a framework for solving learning problems with non-linear functions of classification rates, which is a topic that falls under the broad category of machine learning. Specifically, the paper focuses on constrained optimization problems related to fairness and distribution divergences, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-categories of "cs.LG" (Machine Learning), "cs.AI" (Artificial Intelligence), or "cs.CR" (Cryptography and Security). Additionally, the paper mentions convergence guarantees for convex functions of rates, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-categories of "cs.DS" (Data Structures and Algorithms) or "cs.SI" (Social and Information Networks). Overall, the most likely sub-category is "cs.LG" due to the focus on machine learning and optimization, followed by "cs.AI" and "cs.CR" for their relevance to fairness and security.
